data.text: SUPPLEMENT TO CORTADO SERVICE PROVIDER AGREEMENT This is a Supplement to the Cortado Service Provider Agreement dated August 8,2011 (the “Agreement”) between ProNet Solutions, Inc., an Arizona corporation located at 4313 E Cotton Center Blvd Ste 120, Phoenix, Arizona 85040 (“ProNet”), and Cortado, Inc., located at 750 Grandview Ave., Suite 200, Denver, Colorado 80002 (“Cortado”) and is effective as of the date both parties have executed it (the “Effective Date” in the provisions below). It establishes, in the numbered Parts below, terms and conditions to be incorporated into the Agreement. Definitions appearing at the end of any Part of this Supplement shall apply to the words or phrases defined wherever those defined words or phrases are used in this Supplement. Unless the context clearly requires otherwise, the word “include” is non-limiting, and the words “agree” and “notify" (or “provide notice”) mean to do so in writing. In the event of a conflict, ambiguity or contradiction between this Supplement and any other part of the Agreement or any license agreement contemplated by the Agreement, this Supplement takes precedence. PART 1. TERM OF THE AGREEMENT a. EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL. (1) [INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK] (2) [INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK] (3) Following any notification by either Party to the respective other Party that they desire to negotiate the terms of extension of renewal of the Agreement, the Parties to the Agreement shall mutually discuss the basis upon which they may wish to renew or extend the Term, Service, lease or license, as applicable. However, either Party’s right to prevent automatic renewal or extension or elect a renewal or extension, as the case may be, shall be unconditional, subject only to its giving timely notice of nonrenewal or renewal. b. TERMINATION. Either Party may terminate the Agreement, without penalty (i) at any time upon giving the respective other Party six (6) months prior notice of its intent to do so or (ii) in the event of a Change in Control of the respective other Party, upon giving thirty (30) days prior notice to the respective other Party. In the event of any termination by ProNet pursuant to this Section b, ProNet shall be obligated to pay for the work successfully completed by Cortado through the effective date of such termination. c. DEFINITIONS (1) A “Change in Control” is any event or series of events by which (i) any person or entity or group of persons or entities shall acquire control of another person or entity or (ii) in the case of a corporation, during any period of 12 consecutive months commencing before or after the date hereof, individuals who at the beginning of such 12-month period were directors of such corporation shall cease for any reason to constitute a majority of the board of directors of such corporation. (2) The “Cortado Services” are services of any kind and in any form provided to ProNet by Cortado under the Agreement, including data processing, software hosting, software as a service, knowledge or information services, provision of work or workers on an outsourced basis, production management, consulting, customization or other custom development, facility management, maintenance, training and support. (3) A “Party” is ProNet or Cortado, and the “Parties” are ProNet and Cortado (4) The “Term” is the term of the Agreement, including any extensions or renewals. PART 2. SAFETY AND SECURITY a. SAFETY AND SECURITY ON PREMISES. Cortado Personnel must comply with all ProNet postings and notices provided or reasonably made known to them in advance regarding safety and security when on the premises of ProNet, and with the postings and notices of ProNet Clients or their customers provided or reasonably made known to such Cortado Personnel regarding safety and security when on the premises of such Clients or customers. Cortado Personnel must not carry weapons or ammunition onto the premises of ProNet, ProNet Clients or their customers and must not use or carry weapons or ammunition while attending ProNet-sponsored events. b. ACCESS PRIVILEGES AND RESTRICTIONS. In the event that Cortado Personnel will receive user-IDs to access ProNet’s applications, systems or servers, or those of ProNet Clients or their customers, the following provisions shall also apply: (1) Cortado shall provide ProNet with the full legal names of all personnel that will be issued user-IDs, and Cortado shall not request that such a user-ID be provided or provide such a user-ID or to any individual that will not be directly engaged by or at the request of ProNet to provide Cortado Services. (2) ProNet reserves the right to deny any user-ID request or terminate any user-ID that has been provided. Cortado shall notify ProNet within twenty-four (24) hours of any changes to the Cortado Personnel for whom such a user-ID has been requested or to whom such a user-ID has been provided. (3) Cortado shall not permit any such user-id to be used by more than one individual. c. INFORMATION SECURITY PROGRAM. ProNet and Cortado acknowledge and agree that as of the effective date of the Contract, Cortado will not have or require access to ProNet’s data or that of ProNet Clients or their customers to perform its obligations under the Contract. If, notwithstanding the foregoing, Cortado should at any time have or require such access, Cortado agrees that it will be responsible for establishing and maintaining an information security program to (i) ensure the security and confidentiality of ProNet’s data or that of ProNet Clients or their customers that may come into the possession or control of Cortado, (ii) protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such data that may be in the possession of Cortado, and (iii) protect against unauthorized access to or use of such data that could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to ProNet, or to any ProNet Clients or their customers. In the event Cortado may have access to any such data, the following provisions apply: (1) Cortado shall maintain security for its own systems, servers, and communications links as necessary to protect ProNet’s or Clients’ networks or those of their customers. Cortado’s security controls must include (i) anti-virus/malware devices, (ii) DMZ subnet and firewall controls, (iii) IDS/IPS controls, (iv) patch management controls, (v) physical security controls, and (v) change management controls. (2) Cortado shall contract with an appropriately qualified third party security assurance vendor, to have performed, on a semi-annual basis, a security assessment that includes intrusion testing. Results of these tests will be forwarded to ProNet within ten (10) business days of the receipt by Cortado from the Cortado. If after reviewing such test results, ProNet believes that additional testing is warranted, Cortado shall discuss such additional testing with ProNet in good faith. (3) Cortado shall notify ProNet of any and all breaches to Cortado’s security and work with ProNet management to identify the root cause of the incident and the potential impact to ProNet, as reasonably requested by ProNet. (4) Cortado shall allow ProNet or one of ProNet’s approved third-party security vendors to perform periodic vulnerability scans and penetration tests of those components of Cortado’s environment, if any, required to support the Cortado Service. ProNet agrees to share the results of any scan or test it performs in Cortado’s environment to assist Cortado in correcting any security vulnerabilities identified. Cortado shall correct any security vulnerability identified in ProNet’s scans and penetration tests in accordance with the following schedule which based on severity level: (a) High severity vulnerabilities will be corrected within sixty (60) business days; (b) Medium severity vulnerabilities will be corrected within ninety (90) business days; (c) Low severity vulnerabilities will be corrected within one hundred eighty (180) business days. Cortado will be considered to have access to such data in the event that a communications link (defined as a pre-established communications path from the customer premises, through a carrier network, to the ProNet network) exists between any of Cortado s’ systems or servers and any of ProNet’s systems or servers on which such data is stored. d. DEFINITIONS (1) An “Affiliate” of a party is an entity which, directly or indirectly is controlled by, or is under common control with that party. (2) A “Client” or “ProNet Client” is any current or prospective client or other customer of ProNet or a ProNet Affiliate. (3) “Cortado Personnel” are employees of Cortado, or of any Subcontractor, which are assigned to perform Cortado Services. Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 2 of 9 (4) A “Subcontractor” is any individual other than an employee of Cortado, or any corporation or other entity, which is engaged directly or indirectly by Cortado to perform any obligations of Cortado obligations under the Agreement, in whole or in part. PART 3. SAFEGUARDING OF INFORMATION a. PROTECTION OF ProNet CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION. ProNet and Cortado acknowledge and agree that as of the effective date of the Agreement, Cortado will not have or require access to ProNet Confidential Information to perform its obligations under the Agreement. If, notwithstanding the foregoing, Cortado should at any time have or require such access, Cortado agrees that it will protect all ProNet Confidential Information with at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information, but in no event shall Cortado use less than a reasonable standard of care for any ProNet Confidential Information. (1) Cortado shall (i) restrict the use and disclosure of the ProNet Confidential Information to its employees solely on a "need to know" basis in order to perform Cortado’s obligations in accordance with the Agreement, (ii) ensure that its employees are bound to it by confidentiality obligations at least as protective of the other as ProNet’s Confidential Information as the provisions of this PART 3, (iii) require employees to protect and restrict the use of all ProNet Confidential Information, (iv) establish procedural, physical and electronic safeguards, designed to prevent the compromise or unauthorized disclosure of ProNet Confidential Information and to achieve the objectives of the Guidelines, (v) not use or disclose any ProNet Confidential Information except as expressly provided in the Agreement, (vi) promptly investigate any security breach to determine whether such incident has resulted or is likely to result in misuse or unauthorized possession or disclosure of ProNet Confidential Information; (vii) promptly notify ProNet of any release or breach of ProNet Confidential Information and to the extent requested by ProNet, if an incident has resulted or is likely to result in misuse of NPI or PHI, notify ProNet and each affected ProNet Client or of their affected customers as soon as possible; and (viii) comply with the Guidelines and all current and future Privacy Regulations with regard to or NPI or PHI that are applicable to a third party ProNet. (2) In providing any notices of release or breach of ProNet Confidential Information, Cortado shall use commercially reasonable efforts to confirm that the individuals receiving such notifications (including any one or more of ProNet’s managerial staff) are generally responsible for security matters relating to such ProNet Confidential Information. Cortado shall notify ProNet within twenty-four (24) hours of: (i) any actual or attempted unauthorized possession or use of ProNet Confidential Information; (ii) the effect of such use or possession; and (iii) the corrective action taken in response thereto and shall reimburse ProNet for its costs in notifying ProNet Clients or their customers of any such actual or attempted unauthorized possession or use, in making available to them any credit monitoring services, any other costs reasonably incurred by ProNet with respect to any such unauthorized actual or attempted possession or use. (3) ProNet Confidential Information shall remain the property of ProNet, its Affiliate or other party from or through whom it was provided. Except for NPI, PHI or other information protected by the Privacy Regulations, the following exceptions shall apply to this Section a: (a) Cortado shall not be obligated to preserve the confidentiality of any information that: (i) was previously known; (ii) is a matter of public knowledge; (iii) was or is independently developed; (iv) is released for disclosure with written consent; or (v) is received from a third party to whom it was disclosed without restriction. (b) Disclosure of ProNet Confidential Information shall be permitted if it is: (a) required by law; (b) in connection with the tax treatment or tax structure of the Agreement; or (c) in response to a valid order of a U.S. court or other governmental body, provided that Cortado provides ProNet with written notice and ProNet is afforded a reasonable opportunity to obtain a protective order. (4) At the end of the Term, or upon termination of the Agreement, Cortado shall destroy all ProNet Confidential Information in a manner designed to preserve its confidentiality, or, at ProNet’s written request and expense, return it to ProNet. b. PRIVACY. If in connection with the Agreement Cortado receives, stores or accesses any NPI, PHI or other information or materials that are subject to the Privacy Regulations, Cortado shall comply with the applicable requirements of such Privacy Regulations. Without limiting the foregoing, and in addition to the confidentiality and security obligations otherwise set forth in the Agreement, Cortado shall (i) ensure the security and confidentiality of such information or materials; (ii) protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such records; (iii) detect unauthorized access to or use of such records or information and (iv) protect against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information that would result in harm or inconvenience to any ProNet Client or any customer of a ProNet Client. Cortado acknowledges that the Guidelines include provisions Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 3 of 9 regarding the safeguarding consumer information, response programs and notice in the event of unauthorized access to consumer information, that ProNet provides information processing services to Clients subject to the Guidelines, and that ProNet may be required to notify Clients, their customers or other third parties of security incidents that result, or are likely to result, in the in misuse or unauthorized possession or disclosure of NPI or other Confidential Information. Cortado agrees to cooperate with ProNet in making any such required notifications. c. SPECIFIC PRECAUTIONS. Cortado represents and agrees that it has and will maintain in place commercially reasonable precautions to safeguard the confidentiality, security and integrity of ProNet Confidential Information in a manner designed to meet the requirements of this PART 3. These precautions shall include (i) contractual restrictions on access to the information by Cortado’s vendors and contractors, (ii) intrusion detection systems on all information systems of ProNet maintained or controlled by Cortado, and (iii) notification procedures for notifying ProNet promptly in the event a security breach is detected or suspected, as well as other response programs when there is a suspected or detected unauthorized disclosure, access or attempted access of non-public personal information. These precautions shall also include, as appropriate: (i) access controls to ProNet information systems, including controls to identify and permit access only to authorized individuals and controls to prevent access to ProNet Confidential Information through fraudulent means; (ii) employee controls and training; (iii) physical access restrictions at locations where ProNet Confidential Information is located; (iv) encryption of electronic ProNet Confidential Information when appropriate or legally required; and (v) a disaster recovery plan as appropriate to protect against loss or damage to ProNet Confidential Information due to potential hazards such as fire or water damage or technological failures. Cortado shall (i) monitor the foregoing measures with periodic audits or testing and provide copies of the same sufficient to assure to ProNet or its regulatory authorities that Cortado is implementing these precautions and (ii) notify ProNet immediately in the event there is any suspected or actual unauthorized access, use, disclosure or alteration to ProNet Confidential Information. d. DEFINITIONS (1) “ProNet Confidential Information” is information disclosed in any form in connection with the Contract to Cortado, or to a Cortado Affiliate or Subcontractor, by ProNet, a ProNet Affiliate or a ProNet Client, or by a customer of a ProNet Client, regardless of the manner of disclosure (including disclosure by giving access), that constitutes or contains either (a) NPI or PHI, or (b) other data or information which is not generally known, including business information, specifications, research, software, trade secrets, discoveries, ideas, know-how, designs, drawings, flow charts, data, computer programs, marketing plans, budget figures, and other financial and business information. ProNet designates the Agreement as ProNet Confidential Information, as well as (i) ProNet’s business strategy and direction, (ii) ProNet’s operating or marketing plans, (iii) ProNet’s employee records (name, address, phone number, salary, taxpayer or government identification number, date of birth, health records, bank account information, labor party), (iv) memos or other documents or communications pertaining to pending litigation or contracts, (v) any'information disclosed by ProNet that is designated as “confidential” at or prior to disclosure and (vi) information of the kind described by any of the foregoing categories that is of or disclosed by a ProNet Client, a ProNet Affiliate, or a customer of a ProNet Client. Without limiting the foregoing, Cortado shall treat as ProNet Confidential Information all. (2) The “Guidelines” are the standards and guidelines established pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act of 1999, relating to the protection of personal nonpublic information provided to financial institutions (“NPI”), pursuant to the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996, relating to the protection of protected health information (“PHI”) or pursuant to or other relevant privacy laws. (3) The “Privacy Regulations” are the standards, guidelines and other regulations established by various federal or state regulatory agencies to protect the privacy and security of customer or patient information held by financial institutions, medical ProNets and other entities, including the Guidelines. PART 4. PURCHASE AND USE OF PRODUCTS a. PURCHASING BY ProNet AFFILIATES. Unless Cortado objects to a ProNet Affiliate’s participation by way of an Agreement as provided below, any ProNet Affiliate may purchase Products under an Agreement to the same extent as ProNet, so long as it continues to be a ProNet Affiliate and holds a valid Agreement. Subject to any such objection, each ProNet Affiliate is an intended third party beneficiary of the Supplement, entitled to rely upon all rights, representations and warranties made by Cortado under an Agreement to the same extent as if such Affiliate were ProNet hereunder. If either (i) Cortado reasonably believes that the nature of a particular ProNet Affiliate’s business is substantially unrelated to the business of ProNet or (ii) the ownership of voting securities between a particular ProNet Affiliate and ProNet, or between any two entities forming a link in Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 4 of 9 the chain of control required to establish the ProNet Affiliate’s status as an “Affiliate” under Section d(1 )of PART 2 above is less than fifty percent (50%), Cortado may object to the ProNet Affiliate’s participation by way of an Agreement, provided Cortado gives written notice of its objection and the basis for objection to the ProNet Affiliate, with a copy to ProNet, prior to fulfilling or otherwise accepting the initial order by the ProNet Affiliate under the Agreement. b. TRANSFER AND USE. Notwithstanding any restrictions on assignment or transfer of less than full ownership of any Product procured by a Purchaser under an Agreement, the Purchaser may (i) freely transfer the Product to any ProNet Affiliate, together with the Purchaser’s rights in the Product and (ii) allow any ProNet Affiliate to exercise any rights which the Purchaser may exercise under the Contract with respect to the Product, if and when agreed between the Parties in writing. c. END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT. The End User License Agreement described in the Agreement, in its current version as included in the installation routine, is attached to this Supplement for reference purposes only as Exhibit 1. Newer versions of the Software may contain newer versions of the End User License Agreement; provided that only commercially reasonable changes to the End User License Agreement that are due to the changes to the Software and within the scope of the attached End User License Agreement shall apply to ProNet. The Parties agree that this Supplement in no way affects the validity of the End User License Agreement except as expressly stated otherwise. d. DEFINITIONS (1) A “Product” is any item of goods or services of any kind and in any form provided under an Agreement, including equipment, supplies, data and software. (2) The “Purchaser” of a Product is the party that has purchased or otherwise procured the Product under an Agreement. PARTS. FEES a. PAYMENT TERMS. ProNet shall not be obligated to pay Cortado fees or other amounts under an Agreement less than forty-five (45) days following ProNet’s receipt of a correct and undisputed invoice submitted to ProNet by Cortado. Except as otherwise expressly set forth in an Agreement, Cortado shall not invoice ProNet for any Products or associated expenses prior to completion or acceptance, as applicable, of the requisite delivery or other performance, or the end of the month or other agreed time period for which the fees are being charged, in the case of Cortado Services provided on a time and materials basis. ProNet may withhold payment of any amount disputed in good faith pending resolution of such dispute. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any contract, invoice, document or form issued by Cortado, whether signed or otherwise accepted by ProNet, ProNet will not be obligated for the payment of, late payment fees or penalties of any kind whatsoever. b. BILLING RECORDS. Cortado shall create and maintain accurate records and supporting documentation for all invoices during, and for two (2) years following the end of the applicable billing period. The parties shall use reasonable efforts to schedule, within five (5) business days of ProNet’s written request for the verification described in this section b, a date or dates when ProNet may verify Cortado’s compliance with this PART 5, to occur within two (2) weeks of the request at the earliest, or such longer period as ProNet may specify in its request. Such verification will be conducted in a manner that minimizes disruption to Cortado’s business. ProNet may use an independent auditor to assist with such verification provided ProNet has a written confidentiality agreement in place with such independent auditor. Cortado agrees to provide to ProNet and its auditors accurate electronic and written records, system tool outputs, and other requested system information sufficient to provide verification that Cortado’s billing invoices are accurate and in compliance with this PART 5. ProNet will notify Cortado in writing if any such verification indicates that Cortado is not in compliance with this PART 5, and Cortado shall promptly reimburse ProNet for any overpayments made by ProNet under the Contract. The rights and obligations set forth in this Section shall remain in effect during the Term and for two years following the end of the Term. c. FEE INCREASES. Cortado shall not increase its fees during the Term of the Agreement. PART 6. INDEMNIFICATION. a. INDEMNITY. Cortado shall indemnify, hold harmless and defend at its own expense ProNet, or a ProNet Affiliate, subcontractor or Client, and its officers, directors and employees, against any action, litigation, or claim brought against it by any third party for actual or alleged (i) infringement of any trademark, patent, copyright or other intellectual property right (including misappropriation of trade secrets) based upon, related to, or arising out of any goods or services provided under the Agreement, (ii) negligence, gross negligence, willful misconduct or failure to comply with applicable laws, rules and regulations by Cortado, or by a Cortado Affiliate or a Subcontractor, in connection with performance under the Agreement, or (iii) breach of any obligation under PART 3 (SAFEGUARDING OF INFORMATION). Cortado’s indemnification obligations under this Section a shall include Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 5 of 9 any and all liabilities, losses, costs, damages, and expenses (including court costs and reasonable attorneys' fees) associated with each Claim. No limitation or exclusion of liability or remedies shall be effective with respect to any indemnification or hold harmless obligation of Cortado under the Agreement.. b. CONDITIONS ON OBLIGATION. Any indemnification obligation of the Indemnifying Party to indemnify an Indemnified Party for a Claim is contingent upon: (i) the Indemnified Party promptly notifying the Indemnifying Party in writing of the Claim; (ii) the Indemnifying Party having sole control over the defense and settlement of the Claim; (iii) the Indemnified Party reasonably cooperating with the Indemnifying Party during defense and settlement efforts with respect to the Claim; and (iv) the Indemnified Party not making any admission, concession, consent judgment, default judgment or settlement of the Claim or any part thereof. c. REMEDIAL MEASURES. If an order, judgment or settlement is obtained or reasonably anticipated against either Party’s use of any Product on the basis of any Claim, the Indemnifying Party shall at its sole discretion, cost and expense promptly eliminate the infringement by either (i) acquiring a license or licenses on the Indemnified Party’s behalf to provide the necessary rights to the Indemnified Party, (ii) modifying the Product without impairing its functionality, or to the extent the Indemnifying Party is unable to successfully eliminate the infringement by either of the foregoing courses of action, notwithstanding Cortado’s best efforts, (iii) provide the Indemnified Party with a non-infringing substitute for the Product that provides the Indemnified Party with the same functionality as the Product. d. DEFINITIONS (1) “Claim” means any action, litigation, or claim for which party is subject to an indemnification obligation under the Contract. (2) “Indemnified Party" means a party that is entitled to be indemnified by respective other Party with respect to a Claim. (3) “Indemnifying Party” means a party that is obliged to indemnify the respective other Party with respect to a Claim. PART 7. NO PREFERENCES OR EXCLUSIVITY. Neither Cortado nor ProNet shall be required in any way to accord preferential or exclusive status to the other party by reason of the Contract or the relationship established thereby, and neither party shall by reason of the Contract or the relationship established thereby be required to purchase or use the other’s goods or services to the exclusion of others or to purchase, use or otherwise achieve any minimum volumes or activity with respect to the other party’s goods or services. PART 8. ASSIGNABILITY. Either party may, without consent or notice, assign the Agreement to an Affiliate of that party pursuant to any merger or acquisition of all or substantially all of its assets and otherwise may assign an Agreement to an Affiliate only with the other party’s prior written consent, which the other party may not withhold or delay unreasonably. In addition, ProNet may partially assign an Agreement with respect to Products used by ProNet Affiliate or a division, department or other segment of ProNet or a ProNet Affiliate that is the subject of a divestiture by ProNet or a ProNet Affiliate (regardless of the form of transaction) pursuant to a mutually acceptable partial assignment and release agreement among ProNet, Cortado and the assignee. ProNet and Cortado hereby agree that an agreement materially consistent with the form of Partial Assignment and Release Agreement attached as Exhibit 2 will be mutually acceptable. PART 9. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. Cortado’s liability shall be unlimited with respect to intentional misconduct or gross negligence and with respect to death, personal injury or property damage. No limitation of liability shall apply with respect to any indemnification obligation arising under the Agreement on the part of Cortado or to limit Cortado’s liability to less than the total amount paid or payable under the Agreement or one million dollars ($1,000,000), whichever is greater. Under no circumstances shall ProNet have any obligation to Cortado under any theory of liability or otherwise for any losses caused directly or indirectly, in whole or in part, by (i) Cortado, (ii) a third party other than ProNet’s authorized agents, (iii) adherence to Cortado’s specifications, (iv) improper or incomplete systems, data, software or equipment supplied by Cortado, (v) a force majeure event or (vi) anything not attributable to ProNet or under ProNet’s ability to control. Cortado shall not be liable to ProNet or its Affiliates for damages incurred by a force majeure event, anything not attributable to Cortado or Cortado’s ability to control, or for any loss of income, loss of goodwill or business reputation, loss of opportunity or profits, cost of recovery or any special, punitive, incidental, consequential or indirect damages arising out of or in connection with the Framework and Agreement or the services provided hereunder, however caused and on any theory of liability. The limitation will apply even if Cortado has been advised of the possibility of such damage. PART 10. PERFORMANCE a. DELAYS. In the event Cortado’s performance is delayed, or is anticipated by Cortado to be delayed, by a Force Majeure Event, Cortado shall promptly notify ProNet of (i) the date and details of the Force Majeure Event and the Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 6 of 9 anticipated duration of the Force Majeure Event and the delay,(ii) any material changes in such details or anticipated duration, and (iii) when the Force Majeure Event or delay ends. Cortado shall use its best efforts to perform in a timely manner, utilizing all resources reasonably required in the circumstances including reasonably available supplies or services from other sources. No excuse of a performance delay due a Force Majeure Event shall preclude ProNet from exercising any right of termination otherwise available if the delay extends for more than two (2) business days beyond any applicable time for resumption of performance under any disaster recovery plan which Cortado has agreed to follow, or if no such time for resumption of performance applies, then five (5) business days following commencement of the delay. b. SUBCONTRACTORS. Cortado shall not utilize any individual, corporation or other as a Subcontractor without the prior written consent of ProNet. Cortado shall notify ProNet of its intention to utilize a Subcontractor not less than thirty (30) days prior to the date it intends to do so. Cortado shall provide such information and documentation concerning any proposed Subcontractor as ProNet requests. Cortado shall ensure that any Subcontractor complies with all provisions of the Agreement, including ProNet’s right to audit, confidentiality and privacy obligations, information security requirements, business continuity and disaster recovery programs, insurance requirements and any applicable regulatory guidelines and requirements. Cortado is responsible for all Cortado Services regardless of where performed or whether performed by a Subcontractor. c. INSURANCE. Exhibit 3 sets forth minimum amounts of certain types of insurance coverage and other requirements relating to such insurance. Cortado shall maintain all insurance coverage described in the certificate of insurance it has provided to ProNet until such time as Cortado has obtained insurance satisfying the requirements set forth in Exhibit 3, which Cortado shall do within three (3) weeks following the Effective Date. Thereafter, Cortado shall maintain such insurance and comply with such other obligations during the Term, at its own expense. d. NONSOLICITATION. During the term of an Agreement, and for a period of twelve (12) months after its termination, Cortado shall not, directly or indirectly (i) induce or influence any individual who is engaged or employed by ProNet to terminate that engagement or employment or participate in a competitive business or activity, if the individual worked with Cortado or developed a relationship with Cortado in connection with ProNet’s engagement of Cortado under the Agreement, or (ii) induce or influence any ProNet Client to terminate or curtail its relationship with ProNet. e. ONGOING QUALIFICATION OF PROVIDER (1) Cortado shall keep complete, accurate, and up-to-date books and records in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and sound business practices covering all transactions relating to the Agreement. (2) During the term of the Agreement and for any period ProNet is subject to regulatory examination with respect to any Cortado Services, upon at least ten (10) business days written notice from ProNet, Cortado or its agents shall provide ProNet, ProNet’s agents, and/or any of ProNet’s regulators with access to and any reasonable assistance that they may require with respect to any Cortado office or location where the Cortado Services are performed for the purposes of performing audits or inspections of the Cortado Services and the business of ProNet relating to the Cortado Services. Such audits shall be conducted by ProNet, ProNet’s agents, or ProNet’s regulators during business hours at any Cortado office or location where the Cortado Services are performed. If any audit by an auditor designated by ProNet, a ProNet agent or a regulatory authority results in Cortado being notified that Cortado or Cortado’s agents are not in compliance with any law rule, regulation or any term or condition of the Agreement, Cortado shall remedy any such noncompliance within thirty (30) days. Cortado shall bear the expense of any such compliance. Any audit hereunder shall be subject to the following limitations: (i) use of any third party auditor that is a competitor of Cortado shall be subject to Cortado’s prior written approval, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed; and (ii) ProNet or any auditor conducting any such audit shall at all times comply with any and all reasonable security and confidentiality guidelines and other policies of Cortado with respect to the audit. f. COMPLIANCE WITH LAW. In all circumstances, Cortado shall comply with, and shall ensure that all Products comply with all any laws, codes, rules, regulations, ordinances or orders to Cortado’s performance under the Agreement party may be subject (“Laws”), including all Laws relating to export and import, privacy, use, disclosure or transfer of personal information, or security, and all Laws relating to the employment, health, safety and payment of Cortado personnel. Cortado shall perform an on-going review of Laws applicable to Cortado’s performance under the Agreement. Cortado shall maintain the features and functions for all standard Products in accordance with all Laws applicable to such features and functions, including Laws enacted or amended after the effective date of the Agreement. Cortado shall identify and procure all permits, certificates, approvals, licenses, and inspections necessary for Cortado’s performance under the Agreement other than such permits, certificates, approvals, licenses and inspection that ProNet is directly responsible for obtaining under the Agreement. Without limiting any other obligation of Cortado under the Agreement, Cortado shall at all times comply with all Laws relating to the Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 7 of 9 import or export of Products, including Laws relating to trade sanctions, export controls, the U.S. Foreign Assets Control Regulations, the U.S. Export Administration Regulations, and the U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations. g. USE OF ProNet NAMES. Neither Party shall not use the respective other Party’s names, logos, trademarks or stock exchange ticker symbol, or in connection with the Agreement those of any Party’s Client, unless pre-approved in writing by ProNet, and Cortado shall not make any press release or other similar communication that mentions or implies a relationship between Cortado and ProNet, or between Cortado and a ProNet Client if due to the Contract, unless pre-approved in writing by ProNet. h. WARRANTY AGAINST MALICIOUS TECHNOLOGY. Cortado represents and warrants that the Products, as provided by Cortado for delivery to ProNet, Clients or their customers, and while in Cortado’s system/electronic domain will not contain any Destructive Elements and that Cortado will not install, use, or execute any Destructive Elements on any ProNet computers, or computers of ProNet Clients or their customers. If ProNet notifies Cortado that it has been informed or has reason to believe that a Destructive Element was present in the Products as delivered by Cortado to ProNet a ProNet Client, or any customers of a ProNet Client, prior to leaving Cortado’s network and sphere of influence Cortado will promptly assist and work continuously with ProNet, in conformance with ProNet security requirements at no charge, until the Destructive Element has been eliminated. i. DEFINITIONS. (1) A “Destructive Element" is any computer code or other technological device which (i) is intentionally designed to disrupt, disable, harm or otherwise impede in any manner, including aesthetical disruptions or distortions, the operation of a Product, or any other associated software, firmware, hardware, computer system or network (sometimes referred to as "viruses” or ’’worms"), (ii) would disable a Product or impair in any way its operation based on the elapsing of a period of time, exceeding an authorized number of copies, advancement to a particular date or other numeral (sometimes referred to as "time bombs”, "time locks”, or "drop dead” devices), (iii) would permit Cortado or any Subcontractor to access a Product to cause such disablement or impairment (sometimes referred to as "traps", "access codes” or "trap door” devices), or (iv) contains any other similar harmful, malicious or hidden procedures, routines or mechanisms which would cause a Product or any other associated software, firmware, hardware, computer system or network to cease functioning or damage or corrupt data, storage media, programs, equipment or communications or otherwise interfere with operations. (2) A “Force Majeure Event” is any force majeure event condition causing a performance delay to be excused under the Agreement. PART 11. OWNERSHIP. a. [INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK] b. [INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK] c. [INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK], d. LICENSE. To the extent that any preexisting rights are embodied or reflected in the Cortado Services, inventions or work related to the Cortado Services or inventions, Cortado grants to ProNet an irrevocable, perpetual, non¬ exclusive, world-wide, royalty-free right and license to: (i) use, execute, reproduce, display, perform, distribute copies of and prepare derivative works based upon such preexisting rights; and (ii) authorize others on ProNet’s behalf to do any or all of the foregoing. e. WARRANTY. Cortado warrants that it has full right and authority to perform its obligations and grant the usage rights and licenses contained in the Contract as stipulated in Cortado’s End User License Contract. Cortado further warrants that it has neither assigned nor entered into any other relationship by which it purports to transfer any right, title or interest to any technology, process, material or intellectual property right that would be in conflict with the terms of the Contract, nor shall it do so in the future. PART 12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND APPLICABLE LAW. This Agreement shall be construed and governed by the laws of the State of New York (without giving effect to its principles of conflicts of laws). Any action or proceeding seeking to enforce any provision of, or based on any right arising out of, this Agreement must be brought against the applicable Party in the courts of the State of Arizona located in the County of Maricopa, Arizona or, if it has or can obtain jurisdiction, in the United States District Court for the District of Arizona, and each Party hereby consents to the jurisdiction of such courts. The parties hereby irrevocably waive any and all rights to trial by jury in any legal proceeding arising out of or relating to the Agreement. The application of the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods is expressly excluded Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 8 of 9 IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned have caused this Supplement to be executed as of the dates written below. Name: Title: Date: Signat PRONET UTIONS, INC CORTADO, INC. (/eMu.iu.q btyUu, Signature:  .... .. Name: Henning Volkmer Title: President & CEO Date: 12/8/2016 Supplement to Cortado Service Provider Agreement Pg. 9 of 9 EXHIBIT 1 to Procurement Contract Supplement Exhibit 2 to Procurement Contract Supplement Form of PARTIAL ASSIGNMENT AND RELEASE OF AGREEMENT 1. Introduction. By this Partial Assignment and Release of Agreement (“Assignment”), [legal name of ProNet] (“Assignor”) is assigning to [legal name of assignee] (“Assignee”) certain of Assignor’s obligations, liabilities, benefits, rights and privileges relating to or arising under the attached [title of Contract, which is to be attached] (“Contract"). 2. Assignment. Assignor indefeasibly assigns, transfers, sets over, and conveys to Assignee all of Assignor’s estate, right, title, and interest in all of the obligations, liabilities, benefits, rights, and privileges relating to or arising under the Contract associated with the Assignee as of {effective date of Assignment) (the “Effective Date”). Assignor represents and warrants to Assignee that as of the Effective Date there have been no amendments or modifications to or waivers of the Contract which have not been supplied and identified by the Assignor to the Assignee and that the form and content of the Contract is as supplied and identified by Assignor to Assignee. 3. Acceptance of Assignment. Assignee accepts such assignment and agrees to be liable for any obligations or liabilities that arise or accrue under the Contract relating to Assignee as of the Effective Date. 3. Release. In consideration of the foregoing, Cortado, its predecessors, successors, parents, direct subsidiaries, indirect subsidiaries, affiliates, assigns, heirs, agents, and attorneys hereby remise, release and forever discharge Assignor, and all its predecessors, successors, parents, direct subsidiaries, indirect subsidiaries, affiliates, and their assigns, agents, directors, officers, employees, heirs, personal representatives, and shareholders from and against all actions, causes of action, claims, suits, debts, damages, judgments, liabilities, demands and controversies whatsoever, whether matured or unmatured, whether at law or in equity, whether before a local, state or federal court or state or federal administrative agency, commission or arbitration administrator, and whether now known or unknown, liquidated or unliquidated, that Cortado now has or may have had, or thereafter claims to have, regarding the issues arising out of or directly or indirectly related to the Contract in respect to the Assignee, on behalf of itself, or any other person or entity, at any time prior to and including the Effective Date. Cortado warrants and agrees that it has neither assigned, pledged, hypothecated, nor otherwise divested itself or encumbered any part of the claims being released hereby; that no other person or entity has any interest in or ownership of the claims covered by this Assignment, and that Cortado will indemnify, defend, and hold Assignor harmless from and against any of all of any part of the claims so assigned, pledged, hypothecated, divested or encumbered. 4. No Admission. It is understood and agreed among Cortado, Assignor and Assignee that this Assignment is a compromise and shall never be construed as an admission of liability, wrongdoing or responsibility on the part of any party, or on the part of any party’s predecessors, successors, assigns, agents, parents, subsidiaries, affiliates, officers, directors, employees, heirs, personal representatives, or shareholders. Rather, each party expressly denies any such liability, wrongdoing or responsibility. Moreover, neither the release set forth herein nor a party’s execution and performance of this Assignment shall be construed by any person or in any court, agency or tribunal whatsoever as a present or past admission of liability, wrongdoing or responsibility. 5. Confidentiality. The parties agree that this Assignment and its terms are and shall be kept confidential by the parties. Except to the extent necessary to enforce this Assignment or to the extent that either of the parties reasonably believes it is required by law to disclose certain of the terms of this Assignment to its stockholders, or in the filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, a state or federal regulatory body; or to the extent that any of the parties is required to disclose the terms of its individual settlement to the taxing authorities, preparers, or others with respect to tax matters; or to the extent required by subpoena or other order of a court or government body of competent jurisdiction or at the request of the FCC; the terms and conditions of this Assignment, including the amounts of any payment shall remain confidential and shall not be disclosed. To the extent required by subpoena or other written order, rule, or regulation of a court or government body of competent jurisdiction, the party being compelled to provide the information will notify the other parties within five (5) business days of receipt of the subpoena or written order. Subject to the same exceptions set forth above, the parties, and their counsel, agree that they will not comment on the substance or terms of this Assignment to any person or entity unless written consent is given by the other, except to the effect that any dispute arising from the Contract was resolved amicably, that the parties and their counsel are bound by the limitations of this Assignment, and as set forth in this paragraph. Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Assignment and its terms may be disclosed to any person who releases claims or against whom claims are released under this Assignment. Miscellaneous. 6. c) d) e) f) g) h) j) k) a) b) Each party agrees to bear its own attorneys’ fees and costs. The parties represent and warrant that each (i) is duly incorporated and/or organized and is in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction set forth in the preamble above, (ii) has the right and authority to enter into, execute and deliver this Assignment as the binding agreement of such party, to agree to the terms and conditions set forth herein, and to receive payments or credits in settlement of any claims under the Contract; and (iii) that neither of the parties has disposed of any of the claims. The parties agree that any provision of this Assignment that is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to such jurisdiction, be rendered ineffective to the extent of such prohibition or unenforceability, without invalidating the remaining provisions hereof or affecting the validity or enforceability of such provision in any other jurisdiction. The Assignment, including all matters of construction, validity and performance shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of Florida without giving effect to the choice of law or conflicts of law provisions thereof. The parties agree to cooperate fully, to execute any and all supplementary documents and to take all additional actions that may be necessary or appropriate to give full force and effect to the terms and intent of this Assignment, including withdrawing with prejudice the claims from the court, arbitrators, regulatory or other governmental body before which such claims were pending. This Assignment may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. This Assignment reflects the entire agreement and understanding between the parties with respect to the settlement contemplated herein, supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements, arrangements, understandings, communications, representations or warranties, both oral and written, related to the Contract. This Assignment may be modified or waived, in whole or in part, only by a written document signed by all parties. No failure or delay by either party in exercising any right, power, or privilege under this Assignment shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise thereof preclude any other or further exercise of any right, power or privilege hereunder. Upon the Effective Date, this Assignment shall be binding on the parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns. The parties each covenant and agree to execute, to acknowledge and to deliver, at their own expense, such other instruments and to take such other actions as may be reasonably required to effectuate this Assignment whenever and so often as reasonably required so to do by the parties hereto, their successors and assigns. Failure by any party to enforce at any time any of the terms and conditions of this Assignment shall not be considered a waiver of that party’s right to enforce such terms and conditions. No waiver by any party of any of its rights under this Assignment shall be valid unless in writing signed by such party, and no waiver of a breach of any provision shall constitute a waiver of any future breach of such provision or a breach of any other provision. This Assignment does not constitute the assumption of the Contract as that term is used under applicable bankruptcy law. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned have caused this Assignment to be executed as of the dates written below. Procurement Contractsupplement Pg. 2 of 2 Exhibit 3 to Procurement Contract Supplement INSURANCE REQUIREMENTS TYPES & MINIMUM AMOUNTS OF INSURANCE COVERAGE Commercial General Liability Insurance: including Premises & Operations, Products/Completed Operations, Contractual, Broad Form Property Damage, and Personal Injury with a combined single limit of at least One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence and Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) general aggregate. Business Automobile Liability Insurance: for all owned, non-owned, borrowed, leased, and hired vehicles to be used in connection with the Agreement, with a combined single limit of at least One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) each accident Worker’s Compensation: with Alternate Employer Endorsement and including at least One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) Employers Liability coverage. Umbrella (Excess) Liability Insurance: coverage in an amount of at least five million ($5,000,000) per occurrence. Property Insurance: against all risks of physical loss or damage to any property of ProNet in the care, custody, or control of Cortado. Professional Liability: in an amount of at least Ten Million Dollars ($10,000,000) including coverage for Network Security Liability and Privacy Liability. Commercial Crime: including employee Dishonesty coverage in the amount of at least One Million Dollars ($1,000,000). OTHER INSURANCE OBLIGATIONS (1) Prior to executing the Agreement and within ten (10) days of each subsequent policy renewal, Cortado shall provide ProNet with certificates of insurance evidencing that the coverage and policy endorsements required under the Agreement are maintained in force with insurance companies that have A.M. Best ratings of at least A- (VIII). (2) Cortado or its insurers shall provide thirty (30) days written notice to ProNet prior to cancellation or material change of any such policy. (3) Except with respect to the gross negligence of ProNet, Cortado’s policies will be primary and non-contributing with respect to any other insurance or self-insurance which may be maintained by ProNet. (4) ProNet shall be named as an additional insured under the Commercial General Liability, Automobile Liability, Umbrella and Professional Liability policies, as well as a Loss Payee under the Crime policy described above. (5) Cortado and its Insurance Carriers shall waive subrogation with respect to the Workers Compensation, Employers Liability, Commercial General Liability and Automobile Liability policies. (6) Cortado will be responsible to ensure that any Subcontractors maintain in force coverage as outlined in this Exhibit, or that coverage is extended under Cortado’s policies. (7) The carrying of the above-described coverage shall in no way be interpreted as relieving Cortado of any other responsibility or liability under the Agreement or any applicable law, statute, regulation or order.

MUTUAL NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT As used in this Agreement, “Affiliate” means with respect to either Party, any partnership, joint venture, corporation, limited liability company, association or other legal entity, however organized (a "Person") that now or hereafter directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by or is under common control with the Party in question. The term "control" including the terms "controlling," "controlled by," and "under common control with" means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to cause the direction of the management and policies of the Person in question, whether through the ownership of voting shares, by contract or otherwise. References herein to the Disclosing Party and the Receiving Party shall include any Affiliate of such Party that discloses or receives Confidential Information pursuant to this Agreement. Both Parties acknowledge that in the course of their discussions, the Disclosing Party may make available to the Receiving Party certain technical, financial or business information, models, names of actual or potential customers or partners, proposed businesses, reports, plans, facts, market projections, methods of operation, data, analyses, work papers, compilations, comparisons, projections, studies or any other tangible or intangible confidential or proprietary information, prepared or used by Disclosing Party, and/or certain information and material identified by the Disclosing Party as “Confidential” (hereafter collectively referred to as “Confidential Information”). Confidential Information may be written, oral, visual, recorded, electronic or otherwise fixed in some media. In addition, Confidential Information includes (i) the fact that information has been made available or is being inspected or evaluated by the Receiving Party, (ii) the fact that discussions are taking place between the Parties, and (iii) any information, work papers, analysis, compilations, comparisons, projections, studies, documents, terms, conditions, correspondence, facts or other materials derived or produced by the Receiving Party, including its employees, contractors or agents, in whole or in part, from Confidential Information. THIS MUTUAL NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) dated as of June 15^2005, is entered into by and between Credit Union 24, Incorporated, having its principal place of business at 2473 Care Drive, Suite 1, Tallahassee, Florida 32308 (“Credit Union 24”), and Fifth Third Processing Solutions, a division of Fifth Third Bank, an Ohio banking corporation having its principal place of business at 38 Fountain Square Plaza, Cincinnati, Ohio 45263 (“Contractor”). Credit Union 24 and Contractor each are individually referred to herein as the “Party”, or collectively referred to herein as the “Parties”. For the purposes of this Agreement, each Party will be referred to as the “Disclosing Party” where it discloses Confidential Information (as defined below), and as the “Receiving Party” where it receives the other Party’s Confidential Information. WHEREAS, the Parties may make available to each other certain technical or business information deemed confidential during the course of such discussions; and WHEREAS, both Parties are interested in entering into discussions regarding a possible business relationship; and WHEREAS, both Parties may use such confidential information to evaluate a possible business relationship with each other (the “Evaluation”); and WHEREAS, each Party seeks to maintain the confidentiality of such confidential information that it discloses to the other Party. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing recitals, premises and the mutual agreements herein contained, and for other good and valuable consideration (the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged), the Parties hereto agree as follows: 1. Page 1 of 4 3. Both Parties acknowledge that all Confidential Information furnished by the Disclosing Party is considered a trade secret and is a matter of strict confidentiality. Each Party also acknowledges that the unauthorized use or disclosure of any Confidential Information may cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party. Accordingly, the Receiving Party agrees that the Disclosing Party may be entitled to equitable relief, including injunction and specific performance, in addition to all other remedies available at law or in equity for any threatened or actual breach of this Agreement. 4. In consideration of the above, the Receiving Party agrees that it will employ the same security measures to Confidential Information received from the Disclosing Party that it would apply to its own comparable confidential information (but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care in handling Confidential Information). Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Receiving Party further agrees that it will not distribute, disclose or convey to third parties any Confidential Information, except as specifically provided in this Agreement. 5. The Receiving Party further agrees that: (a) only Receiving Party’s and its Affiliates' employees, contractors or agents with a need to know shall be granted access to Confidential Information and only after they have been informed of the confidential nature of Confidential Information and agreed to maintain the confidentiality of Confidential Information pursuant to terms no less protective of the Disclosing Party’s interests and rights therein as set forth in this Agreement; and (b) it shall not make use of any Confidential Information other than expressly in connection with performing the Evaluation, and shall not use Confidential Information for purposes of competing with the Disclosing Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, each Party acknowledges and agrees that the other Party may be a competitor and that nothing in this Agreement shall prohibit or restrict either Party from competing with the other Party in any manner, as long as the Confidential Information of the other Party is not used for such purpose. In the event any third party requests the Receiving Party to submit Confidential Information to such third party pursuant to subpoena, summons, search warrant or the Receiving Party is required to disclose any Confidential Information as a result of any other in a judicial, administrative or governmental proceeding or order, the Receiving Party shall notify the Disclosing Party promptly upon receipt of such request to enable the Disclosing Party to object to such request prior to any release of Confidential Information or waive the Receiving Party's compliance with the applicable provisions of this Agreement. If the Disclosing Party objects to the release of Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall permit counsel chosen by the Disclosing Party and acceptable to the Receiving Party to represent the Receiving Party in order to resist any release of Confidential Information. The Disclosing Party shall indemnify the Receiving Party for any expenses incurred by the Receiving Party in connection with resisting the release of Confidential Information. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if, as a result of such request or requirement, the Receiving Party is, in the written opinion of its legal counsel compelled to disclose Confidential Information or be held liable for contempt or other penalty before the Disclosing Party has the opportunity to obtain a protective order or to waive the confidentiality provisions of this Agreement, the Receiving Party may disclose such Confidential Information without, liability to the Disclosing Party under this Agreement, provided that the Receiving Party has complied with the notice provisions of this section; and that the Receiving Party shall disclose only that portion of the Confidential Information that its legal counsel advises that it is legally required to disclose. The obligations set forth in Paragraphs 1 through 6 above shall not apply to: (a) Confidential Information: (i) which was publicly available when received or subsequently becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (ii) which was disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party not under an obligation of confidentiality to the Disclosing Party; (iii) which was independently developed by the Receiving Party not otherwise in violation or breach of this Agreement or any other obligation of the Receiving Party to the Disclosing Party; or (iv) which was rightfully known to the Receiving Party prior to entering into this Agreement; or (b) any disclosure specifically authorized in writing by the Disclosing Party. Page 2 of 4 8. 9. 10. 11. 12. 13. 14. This Agreement is effective upon the date first written above. Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other Party, and all confidentiality obligations shall survive in accordance with this Section 10. The obligations of each Party set out in Paragraphs 1 through 9 above and the provisions set forth in Paragraph 16 below shall survive the termination of the Agreement and the return of any Confidential Information for a period of three (3) years. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the obligations under this Agreement with respect to Confidential Information consisting of trade secrets shall not expire and shall remain in full force and effect. The Receiving Party agrees that all Confidential Information shall at all times remain the sole property of the Disclosing Party and shall be returned to the Disclosing Party or destroyed as set out in Paragraph 9 immediately upon Disclosing Party's demand. No rights or licenses, express or implied, are granted by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party under any patents, copyrights, or trade secrets of the Disclosing Party as a result of or related to this Agreement. If during the Evaluation the Receiving Party determines that it does not wish to proceed with the proposed business relationship, then the Receiving Party (i) shall promptly deliver to the Disclosing Party all documents and other materials comprising Confidential Information, in the possession or under the control of the Receiving Party and its employees, contractors or agents, together with all copies and summaries thereof, and (ii) shall destroy all materials generated or prepared by the Receiving Party and its employees, contractors or agents that include or refer to any part of the Confidential Information, including, without limitation, all analyses, compilations, summaries, studies, notes, machine readable archival copies of Confidential Information and other material without retaining a copy of any such materials. Alternatively, and providing the Disclosing Party provides its prior written consent, the Receiving Party shall destroy all documents and other materials constituting Confidential Information in the possession or under the control of the Receiving Party and its employees, contractors or agents within ten (10) business days after receipt of the Disclosing Party's written consent to such destruction. The Receiving Party agrees that if requested by Disclosing Party, ah authorized officer of the Receiving Party shall certify to the Disclosing Party in writing that all such information and materials have been delivered or destroyed in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the delivery or destruction of Confidential Information and related materials required by this Paragraph 9, any and all duties or obligations existing under this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect as provided in Paragraph 10. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to grant the Receiving Party a license to any Confidential Information disclosed or to any patents, trademarks, copyrights or any other intellectual property derived from the Confidential Information disclosed. Neither Party makes any implied or express representations or warranties as to the accuracy or completeness of the Confidential Information and neither Party shall have any liability to the other resulting from its reliance on or use of the Confidential Information. Each Party further agrees that it is not entitled to rely on the accuracy or completeness of the Confidential Information. The Parties agree that no failure or delay by either Party in exercising any right, power or privilege hereunder will operate as a waiver thereof; nor will any single or partial exercise thereof preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any right, power or privilege hereunder. This Agreement represents the entire agreement between Credit Union 24 and Contractor concerning the confidentiality of the Confidential Information. No modifications of this Agreement or waiver of the terms and conditions hereof will be binding upon the Parties unless approved in writing by each Party. Page 3 of 4 15. This Agreement shall be binding on the Parties and their successors and assigns, and its provisions may only be waived by written agreement of the Parties. The terms and provisions of this Agreement shall be deemed severable, and in the event that any term or provision hereof or portion thereof is deemed or held to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable, the remaining terms and provisions hereof and portions thereof shall nevertheless continue and be deemed to be in full force and effect. 16. This Agreement shall be governed by the internal laws of the State of Florida, without regard to conflicts of laws principles. 17. Each of the undersigned individuals represent and warrant that he has the power and authority to enter into this Agreement and bind their respective companies as their authorized representatives. 18. Once signed, any reproduction of this document made by reliable means (for example, photocopy or facsimile) is considered an original. Unless the context otherwise expressly requires: 1.2.1. references to "including" or "includes" shall be deemed to have the words "without limitation" inserted after them; 1.2.2. any batch of time incurred (for the purposes of calculating the Developer Days) of less than 15 minutes per Developer will be recorded and charged rounded up to 15 minutes per Developer. Any batch of time incurred of more than 15 minutes will be recorded and charged as incurred. For the avoidance of doubt, all actual time incurred on a given Working Day will be aggregated to determine pro-rated charges based on the closest 15 minute increment. 1.2.3. writing or written includes e-mail except that in the case of notices given by one party to the other relating to an alleged breach, an indemnity claim, a Dispute Notice or termination these shall also be sent by registered mail to the address for each party as shown above and notices shall be deemed to have been given upon delivery of such registered mail; and 1.2.4. reference to a clause or Schedule is a reference to a clause of, or Schedule to, this Agreement. Clause and Schedule headings do not affect the interpretation of this Agreement. The Schedules to this Agreement form an integral part of this Agreement and any reference to this Agreement means this Agreement together with the following Schedules: 1.4.1. 1.4.2. Schedule 1 (Customer Requirements); Schedule 2 (Software Description); Schedule 3 (Development Phase Services); and Schedule 4 (Charges). In the case of conflict or ambiguity between the provisions of this Agreement, the conflict or ambiguity shall be resolved in accordance with the following order of precedence: these terms and conditions, Schedule 4 V 10'12-201.1 (Charges); Schedule 1 (Customer Requirements); Schedule 3 (Development Phase Services); and Schedule 2 (Software Description). 1.6. References to this Agreement shall include any amendments agreed in writing between the parties in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. 2. SCOPE 2.1. In consideration of payment of the applicable Charges, Creditcall shall provide to the Customer, in accordance with this Agreement: 2.1.1. the licences to the Licensed Software in accordance with clause 6 (Software Licences); 2.1.2. the Development Phase Services during the Term in accordance with clause 4 (Development Phase Services); and 2.1.3. the Support Services during the Term in accordance with clause 5 (Support Services). 3. COMMENCEMENT AND DURATION 3.1. This Agreement shall commence on the Commencement Date and continue (unless terminated earlier in accordance with clause 18) until the expiry of the Pilot Phase. 4. DEVELOPMENT PHASE SERVICES 4.1. Creditcall will provide the Development Phase Services during the Development Phase and then as required during the remainder of the Term. All hours shall be charged on a time and materials basis at the rate set out in Schedule 4 (Charges) and shall be pro-rated in 15 minute increments in accordance with clause 1.2.2. Creditcall shall provide the Customer with a weekly written report as to the number of Developer Days (or part thereof) incurred in the previous week. Invoices for Development Phase Services will be submitted monthly in arrears. integration assistance 4.2. The Customer shall provide Creditcall with the Customer Materials as required to enable Creditcall to compile the source code of the Licensed Software into object code ("Code Compilation"). 4.3. On completion of Code Compilation, Creditcall shall provide to the Customer the object code (or other such form as the parties may mutually agree) of the Licensed Software ("Licensed Object Code"). 4.4. The Customer is responsible for ensuring that the Customer Materials are suitable for the purposes of Code Compilation by Creditcall. If Creditcail is unable to complete Code Compilation it will notify the Customer. In this event, it is the sole responsibility of the Customer to amend (at the Customer's expense) the Customer Materials as required. 4.5. Following delivery of the Licensed Object Code, it is the sole responsibility of the Customer to complete integration of the Licensed Object Code with the Customer Software to create the Integrated Solution ("Customer Integration"). Certification assistance 4.6. It is the sole responsibility of the Customer to ensure the Integrated Solution conforms with the certification requirements of the Scheme(s). 4.7. The Customer acknowledges and accepts that (unless otherwise agreed in writing between the parties) certification assistance shall not include attendance at such certification. 5. SUPPORT SERVICES 5.1. Creditcall shall, during the Term, provide to the Customer: 5.1.1. telephone and email technical support during Standard Support Hours (including at the Customer's request to those third party suppliers, listed in Schedule 5, providing services to the Customer in relation to the Integrated Solution). Upon receipt of a Support Request Creditcall shall use reasonable endeavours to respond within 1 Working Day. 5.1.2. Maintenance Releases of the Licensed Software as and when required in the absolute discretion of Creditcall acting reasonably, (together the "Support Services") provided that: 5.1.3. the Customer has paid all applicable Charges due as invoiced to it by Creditcall; 5.1.4. the Customer has used the Licensed Software in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and the reasonable written instructions of Creditcall relating to the use of the Licensed Software as set out in the Software Description (as may be updated by written notice from time to time where required as a result of Scheme changes); and 5.1.5. no change or alteration has been made (or attempted to be made) to the Licensed Software. v 10/i2.?f;14 5.2. It is the sole responsibility of the Customer to ensure (and Creditcall shall have no liability to the Customer in respect of such): 5.2.1. that the Integrated Solution, following the installation of a Maintenance Release, conforms with al! Scheme certification requirements as applicable; and 5.2.2. all Customer Software is capable of operating with a Maintenance Release. 5.3. The Customer must promptly install any Maintenance Release where notified by Creditcall that such is as a result of mandated requirements from an applicable Scheme. 5.4. For the avoidance of doubt, the Customer shall be responsible for any additional costs that may be associated with integration, pre-certification and certification of the Integrated Solution following the installation of any Maintenance Release. 6. Creditcall hereby grants (subject to the terms of this Agreement), the Customer and the Customer Group Companies a non-exclusive, non-transferable, sub-licensable (subject to Creditcall's prior written consent), royalty-free, non-perpetual, revocable (in the event of Creditcall terminating for cause under clause 18.1) licence in the Territory only to the extent needed to combine the Licensed Software with the Customer Software and Customer Hardware (if any) to create the Integrated Solution (including without limitation to use the Licensed Software in application development, testing and lab certification of the Integrated Solution). Pilot Licence 6.2. Customer Licence 6.3. General 6.4. The Customer shall (and shall use reasonable endeavours as described in clause 6.5 to procure that End Users shall): 6.4.1. not attempt to copy, duplicate, modify, convert, create derivative works from or distribute all or any portion of the Licensed Software (except to the extent expressly set out in this Agreement or allowed by any applicable law which is incapable of exclusion by agreement between the parties); 6.4.2. not attempt to reverse compile, disassemble, reverse engineer or otherwise reduce to human- perceivable form all or any part of the Licensed Software (except allowed by any applicable law which is incapable of exclusion by agreement between the parties); 6.4.3. only use the Licensed Software for its own organisational purposes (except as expressly set out in this Agreement); 6.4.4. prevent any unauthorised access to, or use of, the Licensed Software and notify Creditcall promptly of any such unauthorised access or use. 6.5. Customer may grant the sub-licenses as set out in clauses 6.1 and 6.2, provided that the Customer shall: 6.5.1. ensure that the terms of any sub-licence are in writing, enforceable and substantially the same as the terms of clause 6.4.1 and 6.4.2 of this Agreement (except that the End User shall not have the right to sub-licence its rights and) and the Customer shall provide Creditcall with a copy of the sub-licence on request; and 6.5.2 use code-hardening tools from a third party including code obfuscation and checksum to protect the Licensed Software, within the Integrated Solution, from unauthorised access or use of the Licensed Software. Subject to any early right of termination of this Agreement (in which case the following shall not apply) from the Commencement Date for a period ending 3 months after the start of the Pilot Phase the Customer shall not build (or request a third party to start building) a competing product for the purposes of replacing the Licensed Software in the Integrated Solution or for carrying out a pilot at the same time of a substantially similar Integrated Solution. 7.
